tiles

Class World

  • java.lang.Object
    • tiles.World

  • public class World
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents any one region of the game's large world. A region is made up of a grid of Tiles, which can be occupied by Entities. Entities always spawn from the location and in the same initial state as specified in the world's .entities file.

    • Field Summary

      private boolean playerAdded

      private int width

    • Constructor Detail

      • World

        public World(java.lang.String worldName)
        Creates a new world by loading its corresponding .structure and .entities files. Improper calls to this constructor will terminate the program.
        Parameters:
        worldName - The world name, in format "world00", "world01", etc.

    • Method Detail

      • getCoordsOfTileInFrontOf

        public float[] getCoordsOfTileInFrontOf(Creature c)
        Gets the coordinates of the unoccupied tile in front of the given Creature. If there is no such tile, or if it's not accessible, returns null.
        Parameters:
        c - The Creature from which to look.
        Returns:
        A 2-element float array containing the x coordinate as first element, and the y coordinate as second, or null if the resulting location is not accessible or outside the world.

      • getEntities

        public java.util.Set<Entity> getEntities()
        Gets an unmodifiable version of this world's entity set.
        Returns:
        An unmodifiable version of the entities contained in this world.

      • getEntityInFrontOf

        public Entity getEntityInFrontOf(Creature c)
        Gets the entity in front of the specified Creature, if any.
        Parameters:
        c - The Creature from which to look. Note that the parameter is not of type Entity since Entities don't have a defined looking direction.
        Returns:
        The entity in front of e or null if there is no entity in front of e.

      • getHeight

        public int getHeight()

      • getStructure

        public Tile[][] getStructure()

      • getTileAt

        public Tile getTileAt(float x,
                      float y)
        Gets the Tile at the specified coordinates.
        Parameters:
        x - The x coordinate, with a value within [0, world width)
        y - The y coordinate, with a value within [0, world height)
        Returns:
        The corresponding tile or null if the specified coordinate is outside of the world's bounds.

      • getWidth

        public int getWidth()

      • killEntity

        public void killEntity(Entity e)
        "Kills" an entity by removing it from its tile and from the world's entity set.
        Parameters:
        e - The entity to kill.

      • setPlayer

        public void setPlayer(Player p)
               throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Adds the specified player to the World. Only one player can be present in the World at the time. Used when switching between worlds.
        Parameters:
        p - The Player to add.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If this world already has a player set.

      • spawnEntity

        public void spawnEntity(Entity e)
                 throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        "Spawns" an entity by putting it in the world and adding it to the world's entity set.
        Parameters:
        e - The entity to spawn.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If the new entity's location is already occupied. These checks should be made before spawning.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object

      • update

        public void update()
        Updates all the Entities contained in this world.
